result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron N. Black was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The forfeiture and costs shall be paid at the rate of $25.00 a month beginning February 20, 2017.

records.addlTxt: Request for Payment Plan, Agreement to Make Payments, and Order

Defendant Aaron N. Black in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Victim rights have been complied with.  Plea of no contest.  Plea colloquy.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court finds defendant guilty. Statement by Attorney Nocco.   Court orders court costs; DNA sample and surcharge.  Case No. 16TR865 plea of no contest.   Court finds defendant guilty and orders forfeiture of $200.50.  Case No. 16CM130 - Attorney Tlusty amends the charge to a county ordinance of disorderly conduct.  Plea of no contest.   Court finds defendant guilty and orders a forfeiture of $263.50 plus victim witness fee of $67.00.  Defendant to pay the obligations at the rate of $25.00 a month beginning February 20, 2017.  Court dismisses Case Nos. 16TR807 and 16TR864.  - rt
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 19, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

Defendant Aaron N. Black in court with Attorney Alec Nocco appearing specially.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Nocco waives reading of complaint, charges and penalties.  Plea of not guilty to all charges.  Bond continued.   Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 6, 2016 at 03:30 pm.  - rt
Victim Request and Order to Remove No Contact from Defendant's Bond - S.L.K.
Victim Request and Order to Remove No Contact from Defendant's Bond - S.L.B.

Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the court. Defendant shall comply with the booking procedures. Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant shall have no contact with S.L.B.-dob: 8-24-87 and S.L.K.-dob: 1-23-69. Defendant shall notify the Clerk of Courts with address within 24 hours.

Initial Appearance set for November 8, 2016 at 1:00 p.m.

Attorney Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Aaron N. Black appeared in court, in custody.  Court finds probable cause for arrest without warrant based on the arrest header.  Attorney Tlusty requests a $250.00 cash  and $250.00 signature bond with booking; no contact with S.L.B. - dob:  8-24-87 and S.L.K. - dob: 1-23-1969 and no possession or consumption of alcohol.  Court orders bond as requested by Attorney Tlusty but added that defendant must notify Clerk of Court's office with his address within 24 hours of his release. Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Next court date is November 8, 2016 at 1:00 pm.  - rt
